episodeTitle: The Devilish Candle! Tears of Regret and Tears of Anger!
description: Mr. 3 traps Zoro, Nami, Vivi, and Brogy in a deadly wax torture device. As the captives slowly turn into wax statues, Zoro contemplates cutting off his own legs to escape. Meanwhile, Luffy battles Mr. 5 and Miss Valentine while racing to save his friends before it's too late.

events.title: Mr. 3 Unveils the Tokudai Candle Service Set
events.description: Mr. 3 reveals his deadly torture device: a massive cake-shaped wax structure with burning candles designed to slowly encase victims in wax vapor. Zoro, Nami, Vivi, and Brogy are trapped on the rotating platform as the wax begins to cover them.
events.significance: First appearance of Mr. 3's signature torture technique, demonstrating the lethal creativity of his Doru Doru no Mi powers and raising the stakes for the Straw Hats.

quotes.text: You will become wax statues, forever preserving the terror on your faces as a morbid work of art!
quotes.speaker: Mr. 3
quotes.context: Mr. 3 explains his torture device to the trapped Straw Hats

events.title: Candle Lock Immobilizes Brogy
events.description: Mr. 3 uses his Candle Lock technique to create large wax shackles that completely immobilize the giant warrior Brogy, preventing him from breaking free despite his massive strength.
events.significance: Demonstrates the hardness and strength of Mr. 3's wax when solidified, showing it can restrain even a giant with over 100 million berry bounty.

events.title: Luffy Engages Mr. 5 and Miss Valentine
events.description: While trapped in wax at his feet, Luffy continues to battle against Mr. 5's explosive attacks and Miss Valentine's weight-changing abilities, trying to reach his captured crewmates.
events.significance: Shows Luffy's determination to save his friends even while handicapped, and continues the conflict with the Baroque Works agents.

events.title: Mr. 3 Reveals His Manipulation of the Giants' Duel
events.description: Mr. 3 reveals to Brogy that he orchestrated the sabotage of Dorry's drink with explosives, causing the giants' century-old honorable duel to be tainted by deception. This enrages Brogy despite his immobilized state.
events.significance: Reveals the extent of Baroque Works' manipulation and shows the dishonorable tactics employed by Mr. 3, contrasting sharply with the giants' warrior code.

quotes.text: Did you really think that explosion was an accident? I set up that entire scheme!
quotes.speaker: Mr. 3
quotes.context: Mr. 3 reveals his manipulation to the captured Brogy

events.title: Zoro Prepares to Cut Off His Own Legs
events.description: Faced with the prospect of becoming a wax statue and dying helplessly, Zoro makes the extreme decision to cut off his own legs to escape the wax trap. He declares that a real warrior would rather be maimed than die in such a pathetic way. Nami and Vivi are horrified, but Brogy recognizes Zoro's warrior spirit.
events.significance: One of the most dramatic moments showcasing Zoro's unwavering determination and willingness to sacrifice anything to continue fighting. This scene becomes iconic in demonstrating his warrior mentality and resolve.

quotes.text: I refuse to die in such a stupid way! I'll cut off my own legs and fight my way free!
quotes.speaker: Zoro
quotes.context: Zoro's declaration before attempting to sever his legs

quotes.text: This is the proof of a real warrior!
quotes.speaker: Brogy

events.title: Karoo Rescues Luffy from the Rubble
events.description: Karoo, Vivi's loyal duck companion, manages to dig Luffy out from beneath the rubble where he was buried by Mr. 5's explosive attack. This allows Luffy to continue his fight to save his crewmates.
events.significance: Demonstrates Karoo's bravery and loyalty, and sets up the final rescue attempt for the trapped crew members.

events.title: The Wax Coating Accelerates
events.description: As the candles burn, the wax vapor increasingly covers Zoro, Nami, and Vivi. Their bodies begin to be encased in hardening wax, with their faces showing increasing desperation. The timer is running out as they face imminent death.
events.significance: Heightens the dramatic tension and creates urgency for the rescue. The visual of the crew slowly being covered in wax creates a memorable and disturbing image.

events.title: Luffy, Usopp, and Karoo Arrive at the Wax Platform
events.description: Just as Zoro is about to cut off his legs, Luffy, Usopp, and Karoo arrive at Mr. 3's torture platform. They vow to defeat the Baroque Works agents and save their friends before the wax completely encases them.
events.significance: Classic cliffhanger rescue timing that prevents Zoro's self-mutilation and sets up the climactic battle of the arc.

quotes.text: Don't worry! We're here to save you!
quotes.speaker: Luffy
quotes.context: Luffy's declaration upon arriving at the wax platform

events.title: Doru Doru Arts: Tejo
events.description: Mr. 3 uses an anime-exclusive wax technique called 'Doru Doru Arts: Tejo' as part of his setup for the torture device.
events.significance: Anime-original technique that expands on Mr. 3's Devil Fruit abilities, though it's not as significant as his other techniques.

events.title: Brogy's Respect for Zoro's Warrior Spirit
events.description: Despite being enemies in circumstance, Brogy expresses deep respect for Zoro's willingness to cut off his own legs rather than die helplessly, recognizing him as a true warrior with the spirit of Elbaf.
events.significance: Establishes the mutual respect between Zoro and the giants, showing that warrior honor transcends temporary alliances.

quotes.text: I refuse to die in such a stupid way! I'll cut off my own legs and fight my way free!
quotes.speaker: Zoro
quotes.context: Zoro's declaration of his willingness to sacrifice his legs

quotes.text: You will become wax statues, forever preserving the terror on your faces as a morbid work of art!
quotes.speaker: Mr. 3
quotes.context: Mr. 3's twisted artistic vision for his victims

quotes.text: This is the proof of a real warrior!
quotes.speaker: Brogy

quotes.text: Don't worry! We're here to save you!
quotes.speaker: Luffy
quotes.context: Luffy arriving to rescue his trapped crew

themes.description: The episode explores the depths of determination through Zoro's willingness to cut off his own legs rather than die helplessly, showcasing the extreme lengths a warrior will go to maintain their fighting spirit.
themes.symbolism: The wax represents inevitable death and helplessness, while Zoro's sword represents agency and the warrior's refusal to accept defeat.

themes.description: The Straw Hats' determination to save each other is highlighted through Luffy's relentless effort to reach his friends and their faith that he will arrive in time.
themes.symbolism: Luffy arriving at the last possible moment symbolizes the power of trust and friendship to overcome impossible odds.

themes.description: Mr. 3's twisted artistic vision of turning living people into wax statues represents the perversion of art when it prioritizes aesthetic over humanity.
themes.symbolism: The wax statues represent death masquerading as art, a cruel mockery of life.
culturalReferences: Historical references to death masks and preservation of the dead

characterSpotlights.development: Zoro's character is defined by his absolute refusal to die helplessly, willing to permanently maim himself rather than accept a pathetic death. This episode showcases his warrior mentality at its most extreme.
keyActions: Trapped in Mr. 3's wax torture device
Decides to cut off his own legs to escape
Gains Brogy's respect as a true warrior
Inspires hope in the other captives
quotes: I refuse to die in such a stupid way! I'll cut off my own legs and fight my way free!

characterSpotlights.development: Mr. 3 is established as a cunning and sadistic villain who views his murders as artistic expression. His methodical torture reveals his twisted personality.
keyActions: Creates the Tokudai Candle Service Set
Reveals his manipulation of the giants' duel
Taunts his victims with descriptions of their deaths
quotes: You will become wax statues, forever preserving the terror on your faces as a morbid work of art!

characterSpotlights.development: Luffy's unwavering determination to save his friends is highlighted as he battles through obstacles and injuries to reach them in time.
keyActions: Battles Mr. 5 and Miss Valentine despite being trapped in wax
Gets rescued by Karoo from rubble
Races to the wax platform with Usopp and Karoo
Arrives just in time to prevent Zoro's self-mutilation
quotes: Don't worry! We're here to save you!

characterSpotlights.development: Despite being immobilized and betrayed, Brogy maintains his warrior spirit and recognizes the same quality in Zoro.
keyActions: Learns of Mr. 3's manipulation of his duel with Dorry
Recognizes and respects Zoro's warrior spirit
Provides moral support despite his helplessness

mangaDifferences.difference: In the anime, Mr. 3 immobilizes Brogy with large wax shackles, while in the manga (Chapter 122), he uses enormous wax swords to pin Brogy down.
The anime adds the technique 'Doru Doru Arts: Tejo' which doesn't appear in the manga.

trivia.fact: This is the first episode to use 'Shōchi no suke' by Suitei Shoujo as the ending theme, which would continue through episode 81.

sources.title: Shōchi no suke - One Piece Wiki

trivia.fact: Episode 74 achieved a 15.6% rating in Japan, ranking 3rd for its timeslot.
The scene of Zoro attempting to cut off his legs became one of the most iconic moments in early One Piece, frequently cited in discussions of Zoro's dedication and warrior mentality.
This episode adapts Chapter 122 of the manga, which is part of Volume 14.
